column1: A quiet plane, bathed in the pale purple light that filters through the atmosphere.
A mercury lake, its still surface as reflective as a mirror.
A field of strange flower-like ice formations.
A stunning multi-colored arch, clearly the result of erosion but nonetheless breathtaking for its otherworldly beauty.
Large tentacle-like biological structures rising several dozen feet from the ground, swaying in the wind.
A waterfall, hundreds of feet tall, more likely liquid hydrogen or methane than water.
Bulbous egg-like formations grow out from the side of a cliff. It’s unclear if they’re organic or a product of the planet’s chemistry.
Sharp, dagger-like rock formations rise from the soil, hundreds of feet tall and wide.
An enormous cave, its ceiling far above and at least a mile wide.
An enormous metal spire, clearly artificial, erected atop a hill that appears to be a giant diamond.
